Danish contribution to WFP for COVID-19 related food emergencies in Horn of Africa, 2020.
The funds availed with this grant will be allocated in support of Strengthen regional and national capacity and enhance preparedness. One of the main barriers for the locust response in 2019 and early 2020 was the lack of aircraft equipped for locust control; furthermore given the possibility of a cause-effect relationship between climate change and desert locust infestations, it is imperative to strengthen regional and national capacity for surveillance and control operations. Through this action FAO will enhance regional capacity by purchasing a new aircraft for control and surveillance operation and donate it to DLCO. Complementary funds will ensure that training, maintenance equipment and other logistic support will be provided. By strengthening DLCO-EA capacity this will benefit all countries across the region.
Due to its nature as a response to a humanitarian appeal operational results are general and highly aggregated and the MFA contribution is thus reflected in the overall results reporting by the partner. Please refer to the hyperlink below.
